content:
Diagnosis:		Adenoid cystic carcinoma of trachea

Staging:		T4N0M0 (AJCC 8th edition)

Management:		Completed definitive radiotherapy 66Gy in 33# March 2023
		Previous debulking bronchoscopy January 2023

Molecular:		MYB-NFIB fusion positive

Current Situation:	Routine surveillance review

[redacted name] attended follow-up clinic today. She remains clinically stable 12 months post-completion of radiotherapy. Her breathing is satisfactory with no stridor or new respiratory symptoms. She maintains good exercise tolerance, walking 2 miles daily. Performance status remains 0. Recent surveillance CT thorax (15/03/2024) shows stable appearance of residual tracheal thickening with no evidence of disease progression or nodal involvement. Bronchoscopy surveillance from last month showed post-radiation changes only with no evidence of active disease. Blood tests are satisfactory. The plan is to continue current surveillance schedule with next CT thorax in 3 months and clinical review thereafter. She understands to contact us sooner if any new symptoms develop.

cancer_timeline.value: Surveillance bronchoscopy shows post-radiation changes only, no evidence of active disease
CT thorax shows stable appearance of residual tracheal thickening, no progression or nodal involvement

patient_facts.value: Good exercise tolerance, walking 2 miles daily

status_updates.value: Tracheal adenoid cystic carcinoma treated with surgery and radiotherapy. Clinically and radiologically stable at 12 months post-treatment.
Stable disease on imaging and bronchoscopy surveillance
